result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan L Bennett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to:  any other sentence.  Huber privileges for work, school and AODA treatment.
Probation may be served in Fond Du Lac County if accepted.

miscConds.notes: Court costs, DNA surcharge,  victim witness surcharges.  To be paid by 5/13/17.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause.
No alcohol or controlled substances.
No contact with Eric Z.
Court makes the defendant eligible to have this case expunged upon successful completion of the sentence.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Course.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

timeConds.notes:
Straight time.  STAYED to be used by the agent and the Court.
**2/10/2016  STAY LIFTED.  To serve 30 days, straight time.  No good time credit.  Order for Commitment signed/filed.

Defendant Ryan L Bennett in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 3 days, Huber privileges for work, school and AODA treatment. IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS.  Probation may be served in Fond du Lac County if accepted.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-30 days in the House of Correction, STRAIGHT TIME, IMPOSED and STAYED to be used by the agent and the Court
-No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Work or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-Complete 20 hours of community service
-No contact with Eric Z.
-No drivers license suspension
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 5/13/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 5/13/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
*Court makes the defendant eligible to have this case expunged upon successful completion of the sentence
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab
Defense sentencing materials filed.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

Defendant Ryan L Bennett in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Adjourn filed.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Ryan L Bennett in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for MOTION HEARING on 4/16/2015 at 10:00 am in Branch 15. Any motions are to be filed by 3/9/2015 and any response is to be filed by 4/9/2015.

Defendant Ryan L Bennett in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Lindsey Anderson, student intern under the supervision of Ronald Dague for David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 1/23/15.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING AND ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ryan L Bennett in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Ryan L Bennett in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
